snippet: New claims for unemployment benefits fell and retail sales rose, painting a picture of improved national health.
abstract: Labor Department reports that initial claims for state unemployment aid fell for fourth consecutive week, dropping by 29,000 to seasonally adjusted 343,000; Commerce Department reports that retail sales rose by 0.3 percent in November; reports offer hopeful signs for the United States' struggling economic recovery.
lead_paragraph: New claims for unemployment benefits fell and retail sales rose, painting a picture of improved national health.

headline.seo: U.S. Jobless Claims and Sales Figures Bolster Hope for Recovery
headline.main: Economic Indicators Bolster Optimism for U.S. Recovery
headline.print_headline: Economic Indicators Bolster Optimism for U.S. Recovery
